name: Vue
description: Vue syntax and Vue Language Server for Nova editor.

config.title: Language Server
config.description: The preferred language server. You can also choose to run without one. Changes will take effect the next time you open Nova.

config.title: Volar
config.description: Volar is the new officially supported language server for Vue. It has been developed specifically for Vue 3.

children.title: Volar
children.description: The path to the Volar executable (if empty, the extension will try to figure it out).

children.title: TypeScript Server
children.description: The path to the TypeScript server library (if empty, the extension will try to figure it out).

config.title: Vetur (legacy)
config.description: Vetur is a language server for Vue.

children.title: Vetur
children.description: Specify the path to the Vetur language server executable (if empty, the extension will try to figure it out).

children.title: Completion
children.description: Options for configuring all about code completion.

children.title: Auto Import
children.description: Include completion for module export and auto import them.

children.title: Tag Casing
children.description: Casing conversion for tag completion.

children.title: Language Features
children.description: Options for configuring all about language features.

children.title: Code Actions
children.description: Whether to enable codeActions.

children.title: Update Import on File Move
children.description: Whether to automatic updating import path when rename or move a file.

children.title: Validation
children.description: Options for configuring all about code validation.

children.title: Interpolation
children.description:
Validate interpolation in <template> region using Typescript language service.

WARNING: Disabled for preventing xxx errors to show up.

children.title: Script
children.description: Validate js/ts in <script>.

children.title: Style
children.description: Validate css/scss/less/postcss in <style>.

children.title: Template
children.description: Validate vue-html in <template> using eslint-plugin-vue.

children.title: Template Props
children.description: Validate props usage in <template> region. Show error/warning for not passing declared props to child components and show error for passing wrongly typed interpolation expressions.

children.title: Misc
children.description: Various options which don't fall into a specific category.

children.title: Ignore Project Warning
children.description: Vetur will warn about not setup correctly for the project. You can disable it.

children.title: Use Workspace Dependencies
children.description: Use dependencies from the workspace. Currently only for TypeScript.

children.title: Experimental
children.description: As the name suggests these options may provide new features but with a stability trade-off. Use them carefully.

children.title: Template Interpolation Service
children.description: Enable template interpolation service that offers hover/defintion/references in Vue interpolation.

children.title: Developer
children.description:
These options are probably usefull only for developers who work on the VLS. You probably want to stick with the defaults.

WIP: Some options are not exposed yet. Missing: VLS Path, VLS Port.

children.title: Log Level
children.description: Log level for VLS.
